entries.title: World Cup: Morocco and Croatia face off in the one match no team wants to play
entries.description: Your team has just lost in the semifinal at a World Cup. You're understandably heartbroken, endlessly replaying the possibilities of what might have been.

entries.title: Days before the holidays, Ukrainians are plunged into darkness and cold by power outages
entries.description: Missile strikes in Ukraine Friday plunged citizens back into cold and darkness, days before the winter holidays. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

entries.title: Jan. 6 panel considers asking DOJ to pursue Trump criminal charges
entries.description: • High-stakes meeting on Trump's taxes set

entries.title: Rep. Lofgren says executive summary will have 'very bad' previously unreleased evidence from Jan. 6 hearings
entries.description: January 6 committee member Rep. Zoe Lofgren (D-CA) speaks to CNN's Jake Tapper about the committee's upcoming final report with recommendations to the Justice Department.

entries.title: Airlines are cutting back on these frequent flyer perks
entries.description: Frequent flyers are preparing to be frequently frustrated as major airlines including Delta and United begin cutting back on some loyalty program perks. CNN's Pete Muntean reports.

entries.title: Former Twitter exec on First Amendment irony: Elon Musk 'can ban whoever he wants'
entries.description: Former Global Chair of News at Twitter Vivian Schiller shares her perspective following Elon Musk's controversial move to suspend the Twitter accounts of prominent media reporters, including that of CNN's Donie O'Sullivan, The New York Times' Ryan Mac, The Washington Post's Drew Harwell and others.

entries.title: High-stakes meeting on Trump's taxes to be held by House committee
entries.description: The Democratic-controlled House Ways and Means Committee will hold a meeting Tuesday to discuss the contents of former President Donald Trump's tax returns.

entries.title: Real-world studies show updated Covid-19 boosters offer important protection against urgent care visits and hospitalizations
entries.description: While the updated Covid-19 vaccines don't offer complete protection against a trip to the hospital or urgent care, they do offer important defense against the virus, particularly for seniors, two new studies show.

entries.title: 'I can't do this anymore': Steve Bannon comments on Trump's trading cards
entries.description: CNN political analysts John Avlon and Errol Louis join "CNN This Morning" to discuss former President Donald Trump's announcement he is selling digital trading cards.

entries.title: In South Africa, private sector steps in to provide services the government won't
entries.description: CNN's David McKenzie is in Johannesburg with a report on just how much South Africans rely on the private sector to fill gaping holes left by the government in services such as electricity, safety and security, and healthcare.

entries.title: Royal aide apologizes in person to Black charity boss for asking where she was 'really from'
entries.description: A meeting "filled with warmth and understanding" took place on Friday between an honorary royal aide and the Black charity founder she repeatedly asked where she was "really from," according to a statement from Buckingham Palace.

entries.title: QAnon follower described as 'ringleader' during Capitol riot sentenced to 5 years in prison
entries.description: The rioter at the front of a mob that chased US Capitol Police Officer Eugene Goodman up flights of stairs near the Senate chamber on January 6, 2021, has been sentenced to five years behind bars.

entries.title: The world is burning more coal than ever before, new report shows
entries.description: The global energy crisis caused by Russia's war on Ukraine has pushed global demand for coal -- the most polluting of all fossil fuels -- to a record high in 2022, the International Energy Agency (IEA) said on Friday.

entries.title: Starbucks union organizers wanted credit-card tipping. Now they're being left out
entries.description: While a debate unfolds online about Starbucks' new credit and debit card tipping option, some workers are frustrated — and it has nothing to do with the etiquette of tipping. Union organizers who asked for this new feature months ago are being left out.

entries.title: Must-watch videos of the week
As water levels drop at this major lake, bodies begin to appear
entries.description: As water levels continues to recede at Lake Mead, more human remains continue to be discovered. This investigator explains why he is sure more bodies will be found in America's largest reservoir.

entries.title: What this African American Hasidic Jewish rapper knows about the power of laughter
entries.description: The story of an African American gang member in Seattle reinventing himself as a Hasidic Jewish rapper in Jerusalem might not sound like your typical comedy series.

entries.title: Could these dinosaurs whip their tails faster than the speed of sound?
entries.description: Diplodocids were a family of dinosaurs with long necks and, often, even longer tails — some species' tails reached 50 feet in length. They were wide-ranging, but especially flourished in what's now the western US around 152 million years ago.

entries.title: Tyler Perry opens up about his past suicide attempts as he mourns Stephen 'tWitch' Boss
entries.description: Tyler Perry is opening up about his mental health history after the death of Stephen "tWitch" Boss.

entries.title: How the Arab world's most populous country became addicted to debt
entries.description: Egypt has dug itself a massive hole of debt. On Friday, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) will extend a $3 billion loan to the country, a fourth aid package in six years, as its financial tailspin continues.

entries.title: Wagner group rep badly hurt in assassination attempt in Central African Republic
FIFA rebuffs Zelensky's request to share message of peace at World Cup final
Russian linked to Wagner hurt in assassination attempt in CAR
entries.description: A Russian citizen closely linked to the Wagner group led by Yevgeny Prigozhin has been injured in an assassination attempt in the Central African Republic, according to Prigozhin and Russian officials.

entries.title: Missing college student Kenny DeLand Jr. is alive, his father says
entries.description: Kenny DeLand Jr., the American student who went missing in Grenoble, France, more than two weeks ago is alive, his father Ken DeLand Sr. told CNN on Friday.

entries.title: 'Best birthday present ever' -- Jane Fonda says her cancer is in remission
entries.description: Just three months after being diagnosed with non-Hodgkin's lymphoma, Jane Fonda has announced that her cancer is now in remission and she is set to stop chemotherapy treatment.

entries.title: Russian missile strikes put entire country under air-raid alarm
entries.description: A fresh barrage of Russian missile attacks across Ukraine on Friday morning put the entire country under air-raid alarm and sent people scrambling for shelter as explosions sounded overhead, with strikes hitting critical infrastructure and knocking out power.

entries.title: How Britain is reacting to Harry and Meghan taking on the royals
entries.description: CNN's Scott McLean asks the British how they feel about the Duke and Duchess of Sussex's documentary, "Harry and Meghan" on Netflix.

entries.title: NBA draft pick retires from basketball citing anxiety, calls it 'the darkest times' of his life
entries.description: Tyrell Terry, a 2020 NBA draft pick of the Dallas Mavericks, has announced his retirement from basketball, citing anxiety.

entries.title: 2-year-old rescued after being swallowed by hippo
entries.description: A hippo has attacked a 2-year-old boy in Uganda, swallowing half of his body before spitting him out, a statement from the Uganda Police Force said on Friday.

entries.title: Europe closes in on Elon Musk after Twitter bans journalists
TikTok might be too big to ban, no matter what lawmakers say
entries.description: In July 2020, the same month former President Donald Trump said he would ban TikTok in the United States, Callie Goodwin of Columbia, South Carolina, posted her first video on the app to promote the small business she had started out of her garage during the pandemic.

entries.title: Massive aquarium explodes in Berlin hotel
entries.description: A 46-foot-high aquarium that was home to around 1,500 exotic fish burst Friday morning, injuring at least two people and sending a flood of water and debris onto a nearby street, police and firefighters in central Berlin have said.

entries.title: The Grinch comes for retailers
entries.description: Weaker-than-expected retail sales in November pummeled market sentiment on Thursday and raised the odds that the Federal Reserve's inflation-fighting interest rate hikes would push the economy into recession.

entries.title: The couple who cycled the world on a tandem bicycle
entries.description: On December 1, Laura Massey-Pugh and Stevie Massey, both from the UK, cycled through a blizzard into Brandenburg Gate in Berlin approximately 180 days after setting off on a journey to become the fastest cyclists to circumnavigate the world on a tandem bicycle.

entries.title: Rookie quarterback Brock Purdy impresses again as San Francisco 49ers clinch NFC West with win over Seattle Seahawks
entries.description: Is there any stopping Brock Purdy?

entries.title: Look of the Week: Katie Holmes's Y2K ensemble goes viral for all the wrong reasons
entries.description: Walk into any Urban Outfitters, Zara or adjacent store today and you'll be greeted by rows of cargo or "parachute" trousers á la Ciara circa 2006. Scroll through Pinterest, Instagram or TikTok and you'll see Gen Z favorites like Dua Lipa, Olivia Rodrigo and influencer Matilda Djerf flaunting flamboyant sequin butterfly tops like they've only just waved goodbye to 1999. But at the iHeartRadio Jingle Bell red carpet in New York last Sunday, when Katie Holmes stepped out in true Y2K style in a royal blue Tove mini dress styled over raw-hemmed jeans and black New Balance trainers, her look went viral for all the wrong reasons.

entries.title: 'There are red lines': Europe warns of sanctions after Twitter bans journalists
entries.description: Elon Musk's decision to suddenly ban prominent tech journalists from Twitter is fanning a fierce backlash in Europe.

entries.title: FIFA rebuffs Zelensky's request to share message of peace at World Cup final
entries.description: A request by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to share a message of world peace at the World Cup final on Sunday has been rebuffed by FIFA, a source told CNN.

entries.title: Henry Cavill won't be returning to 'The Witcher' despite losing 'Superman' role
entries.description: Henry Cavill will not return as Geralt of Rivia in Netflix hit "The Witcher," despite losing his Superman role following a shake-up of the DC Extended Universe.

entries.title: 'Avatar: The Way of Water' could be a 'life saver' for China's cinemas
entries.description: James Cameron's "Avatar: The Way of Water" has premiered in China, 13 years after the original film took the country by storm. It's expected to be a shot in the arm for the world's second-biggest film market, which has been battered by the country's stringent zero-Covid policy.

entries.title: New satellite that will survey most of Earth's water is ready for launch
entries.description: The first mission to survey nearly all of the water on Earth's surface is ready to launch.

entries.title: Black voter turnout was down in 2022. Democratic operatives are panicking about what it could mean for 2024
entries.description: An informal group of Black elected officials has lit up over phone calls and texts since Election Day. They're worried about Black turnout that continues to underperform and talking ideas about how to turn it around before the next presidential election.

entries.title: Magnus Carlsen enjoys stunning undefeated win over reigning US blitz champion Fabiano Caruana
entries.description: Magnus Carlsen enjoyed an undefeated victory over reigning US blitz champion Fabiano Caruana, winning by an 18-point margin.

entries.title: US Patriots could protect Ukraine's power grid; Russia threatens 'unpredictable consequences'
Virgin to fly 'net-zero' transatlantic Boeing 787
entries.description: Virgin Atlantic plans to operate a Boeing 787 from London to New York, powered solely by waste oils and fats, a move hailed as a step toward reducing aviation's significant environmental impact.

entries.title: Japan approves long-range weapons to counter growing threats from rivals
entries.description: Japan on Friday unveiled a new national security plan that signals the country's biggest military buildup since World War II, doubling defense spending and veering from its pacifist constitution in the face of growing threats from regional rivals.

entries.title: Tourists stranded in Machu Picchu amid Peru protests
entries.description: International tourists from around the world have been left stranded in the ancient city of Machu Picchu after Peru was plunged into a state of emergency following the arrest of the country's president.

entries.title: Inventor of the world wide web wants us to reclaim our data from tech giants
entries.description: The internet has come a long way since Tim Berners-Lee invented the world wide web in 1989. Now, in an era of growing concern over privacy, he believes it's time for us to reclaim our personal data.

entries.title: More than a third of parents oppose vaccine requirements in schools, KFF survey finds
entries.description: More than a third of US parents say that vaccinating children against measles, mumps and rubella should be an individual choice and not a requirement to attend public school, even if that may create health risks, according to survey data published Friday by the Kaiser Family Foundation.

entries.title: Russian missile strikes on critical infrastructure have been reported across Ukraine this morning, including in Kyiv and Kharkiv
Azerbaijan's Silk Road: Rethreading history's greatest trade network
entries.description: We're in Sheki, a magical little UNESCO World Heritage city tucked up against the thickly wooded foothills of Azerbaijan's Greater Caucasus Mountains, on a rare tour of the silk factory which for decades has been the region's economic mainstay.

entries.title: A prince. A celebrity chef. A plot. And a warning for democracies everywhere
entries.description: Until last week, hardly anyone had heard of Heinrich XIII Prince Reuss, the 71-year-old descendant of a minor German princely family. Even his family had reportedly ostracized him years ago for his extreme views.

entries.title: Naked golf and playing on ice: These are the world's weirdest courses
entries.description: You'd be hard-pushed to call golf an extreme sport. It is a low-risk game played at a leisurely pace in mostly scenic, but ultimately ordinary, locales.

entries.title: Missile attacks reported across Ukraine, including in Kyiv
Xi Jinping tied himself to zero-Covid. Now he keeps silent as it falls apart
entries.description: For nearly three years, China's leader Xi Jinping has staked his political legitimacy and prestige on zero-Covid.

entries.title: 10 dead, including 5 children, as fire rips through apartment block in Lyon, France
entries.description: At least 10 people, including five children, were killed when a fire broke out Friday morning at an eight-story apartment building in a suburb of the French city of Lyon.

entries.title: Minutes to death: Itaewon Halloween selfies help families piece together tragedy that killed 158
entries.description: "She's smiling, look at her smile, her face." Oh Il-seok looks lovingly at a photograph of his daughter taken in the last hours of her life. As he takes off his glasses to wipe his eyes, his wife whispers, "Ji-min is my friend, she is my best friend."

entries.title: Delisting risks for China tech stocks averted as US gets 'historic' access to audit data
entries.description: US regulators have gained full access to the audits of Chinese companies for the first time, reducing the threat that tech giants such as Alibaba and JD.com could be kicked off US stock exchanges.

entries.title: The world's most fascinating abandoned towns and cities
entries.description: Once thriving spots, these villages, towns and cities now stand abandoned. Their empty buildings, streets and even cars left for nature to reclaim over the years.

entries.title: 15 extraordinary discoveries of 2022
entries.description: We may dream of winning the lottery, but what about finding a medieval-era wedding ring in your yard, or a Byzantine-era mosaic on your farm?

entries.title: '40-foot seas,' no food, no water: Boaters recall 10 days lost in the Atlantic
entries.description: Two New Jersey men are sharing their story after they went missing in the Atlantic for 10 days and were rescued by a vessel passing by.

entries.title: Pakistan's Taliban problem is America's too
entries.description: When the United States withdrew its forces from Afghanistan after 20 years in the country, it did so on a promise that the Taliban once back in government would provide no haven for terrorist groups.

entries.title: NLRB opens door for union for college athletes
entries.description: Are college athletes employees? In a potentially game-changing move, the National Labor Relations Board's regional office in Los Angeles has taken a step forward to define USC players that way.

entries.title: Peru's ex-president Castillo to be jailed for 18 months as protestors declare 'insurgency'
entries.description: Peru's ousted former president Pedro Castillo will remain in pretrial detention for 18 months, the country's Supreme Court ordered on Thursday, as crowds of his supporters protested outside the courthouse and around the country.

entries.title: Two dead and more than 50 missing in landslide near Malaysian capital
entries.description: Two people are dead and more than 50 are missing after a landslide struck a campsite in Malaysia early on Friday, officials said, as search and rescue personnel scoured the site for survivors.

entries.title: Hear CNN reporter's reaction to being suspended from Twitter after reporting on it
entries.description: Elon Musk is suspending the Twitter accounts of some journalists who cover Twitter. Among them are members of The New York Times, The Washington Post, and CNN. Anderson Cooper speaks with CNN's Donie O'Sullivan, a reporter who covered the controversial suspension of a different account, who just had his account suspended this evening.

entries.title: North Korea claims successful rocket test that could bolster its ICBM force
entries.description: North Korea on Friday said it has successfully tested a solid-fueled rocket motor, a development that could lead to Kim Jong Un's regime being able to more quickly and reliably fire an intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) in the future.

entries.title: Elon Musk's Twitter bans accounts of CNN, NYT, WaPo journalists
entries.description: Elon Musk's Twitter on Thursday banned the accounts of multiple journalists covering the technology industry without explanation.

entries.title: 'This is a war': Californians seek affordable housing alternatives
entries.description: At 26, Ixchel Hernandez has become the defender and protector of her family's modest apartment. In the two decades they've lived in their Los Angeles home, the family of four has successfully fought against multiple attempts aimed at pricing and, ultimately, forcing them out.

entries.title: Federal judge says Biden can't yet end Trump-era 'Remain in Mexico' immigration policy
entries.description: A federal judge in Texas has put on hold for now the Biden administration's most recent attempt to end the so-called "Remain in Mexico" program.

entries.title: US Senate voting on stopgap funding bill to avert shutdown
entries.description: The Senate is on track to vote Thursday evening to pass a stopgap bill to avert a government shutdown at the end of this week with funding currently set to expire on Friday at midnight.
